actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on January 15, 2026.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 1928a, clause 10 of rule 1, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly: Ms. Sanchez, Mr. Larsen of Washington, Mr. Norcross and Ms. Kamlager-Dove.

actions-list.header: Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 6913, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China: Mr. Walkinshaw.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of the American Folklife Center in the Library of Congress
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 2103(b), and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following individual to the Board of Trustees of the American Folklife Center in the Library of Congress: Mr. Robert Anacletus Underwood, Tamueng, Guam, 6-year term.

Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 276d, clause 10 of rule 1, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Canada-United States Interparliamentary Group: Mr. Larsen of Washington, Mr. Morelle, Ms. Omar, Mr. Thanedar and Mr. Kennedy of New York.
Mr. Jackson (TX) asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on January 15. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 341
actions-list.actionItem: 79 (Roll no. 28).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 7006.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Crane amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 127
actions-list.actionItem: 291 (Roll no. 27).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Roy amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 163
actions-list.actionItem: 257, 1 Present (Roll no. 26).
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7006 — "Making further consolidated appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 7006 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Cole moved that the committee rise.

At the conclusion of debate on the Crane amendment No. 2, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lois Frankel (FL) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 992, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Crane amendment No. 2.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Crane,  numbered 2 printed in House Report 119-445 to prohibit funding for the National Endowment for Democracy.

At the conclusion of debate on the Roy amendment No. 1, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Hoyer demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 992, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Roy amendment No. 1.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Roy,  numbered 1 printed in House Report 119-445 to reduce the District of Columbia District and Appeals Court funding by 20% and to strike the salary and expense funding for Judges Boasberg and Boardman's staff.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 7006.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Bost to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 992 and Rule XVIII.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 7006 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Specified amendments are in order.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 992. H.R. 7006 — "Making further consolidated appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213
actions-list.actionItem: 210 (Roll no. 25).

actions-list.header: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213
actions-list.actionItem: 209 (Roll no. 24).

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 992 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7006) making further consolidated appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate H. Res. 992, the Chair put the ordering the previous question and announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Scanlon demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 992.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 992 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7006) making further consolidated appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Luttrell to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Robert J. Wittman to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
